info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Swain County through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Bryson City, or near Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee, Cherokee, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, B.R. Parkway-Smoky Mountains To Balsam Gap, Whittier and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
